bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to [Dorsey M. McPherson], October 1, 1879

div1.p: Reed teases McPherson concerning military reports and life in the field.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to [Dorsey M. McPherson], October 1, 1879
div1.p:
Your documents have just been
handed to me by Lt. Overton's Serg't- “Saco” does
not mean “dry”- such indiscriminate hand-
-ling of the “lengua Española” should not
be tolerated. Had you said “Seco”, you would have
been using castilian of the “purest ray
serene”- I'll excuse you this time, however,
you should not say “damned” reports-such
language is abrupt, and “prejudicial to good
order and military discipline”- Say “beastly”,
“blasted”, or “bloody”, but never “damned”,
that is “hardly ever”! I will fill in the
necessary information in Q. Report of Woun-
ded- Your remarks concerning your
camp and its hygienic surroundings
are eminently proper, and should have
been inserted whether “the Gowan” re-
quested or not- That is your duty,
for doing which, you fill your pocket monthly
with $100 of uncle Sam's “sheckels”-- “How”?
Mr Wood's “of the ankle”, should not have
been set down as still under treat-
-ment, for “if this court knows herself,
and she thinks she do”, Your most ancient
uncle Toby has had him under treat-
-ment, for “nigh onto” two weeks! “How”?
Having transferred him to another Hos-
-pital, all your tenderest ties in his
case have been cruelly severed,-“the
silver cord broken” & c “How”? Of course,
you still occupy the position of “Con-
-sulting Surgeon” to “his anklelosity”!
I had heard, on Sunday, that you had
thoughts of asking to have your Contract
annulled, on account of petty annoyances,
such as eating bacon & drinking ani-
-malculae & c- I h at once sat down
& wrote to you, begging you not to
entertain such a thought, but I had
no way of sending my letter- Am
now rejoiced to know that you have
formed wiser resolutions- stick
to it, my dear o, for it will soon
be over. Give my regards to the
“boss” & tell him to hurry up the work,
and to return you quickly & safely
to these expectant & impatient arms!
How would you like to come into
Apache for a week & give me a
week “on the frontier”? will you
do it? If so, (& it would be a favor
to me,) ride in any Tuesday & I will
go out on Wednesday & return
following Tuesday- “How”?

I will attend to your pa-
pers personally- sleep quietly my
boy, and may Heaven spare you to
come back & read a new Text-
book on Physiology by Foster,
just received, (bully!) and also Shitte
& Maisch's Dispensatory 100,000
pages! “Hesche”!
div1.closer:
Ever yours, To be taken on
an empty stomach,
after breakfast!
